workflow_runs.name: QML Tests
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-3053 - Implement Glean Rust for VPN package and initialize it beh…

head_commit.message:
VPN-3053 - Implement Glean Rust for VPN package and initialize it behind feature (#4732)

* Add mozilla/glean as submodule

* Implement Glean Rust lib and initialize it with the VPN

* Change Glean Rust upload status when setting changes

* Put Glean initialization behind feature flag

* Address Owen's comments

* Address baku's comments

* Address build issues surfaced by CI (all but Windows)

1. For Android, iOS and WASM we needed a no-op version of Glean for now
2. The glean submodule needs to be downloaded for Linux CIs
3. For some reason Ubuntu Jammy was adding quotes to the cago build env
   declarations, using `cmake -E env` fixed it
4. Cmake and Fedora were not agreeing on where the OpenSSL package was,
so I changed it to build and install OpenSSL from scratch. That makes
that one job extremely slow... But it's the best I could do.
5. Stop using 3.20 cmake API (cmake_path) when the CI is using 3.16.

* Address Windows CI issue

There was a missing library (ntdll), required by the `mio` Rust dependency.

workflow_runs.name: QML Tests
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from oth…

head_commit.message:
VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from other device (#4623)

* Start periodic operations timer whenver a token is available

1. That is all we need to run those operations
2. That ensures the operations are run also when in the device limit
   screen.

* Skip device check when in StateDeviceLimit

* Always enqueue a remove device task regardless if device is in
DeviceModel

TaskRemoveDevice already deals with the possibility of the device
not being registered to the given user. No need to handle
that in multiple places.

Also by not launching task remove device, operations to take
user out of device limit state don't happen and that leaves users
trapped in device limit screen.

workflow_runs.name: QML Tests
workflow_runs.display_title: Do not set Glean debug view tag by default (#4584)

head_commit.message:
Do not set Glean debug view tag by default (#4584)

The debug view tag is a feature that should really only be used when
developing / testing Glean instrumentation, because it will redirect
pings to the Glean ping debug viewer (https://debug-ping-preview.firebaseapp.com/pings/MozillaVPN).

By leaving it default on we are in practice just flooding the data
pipeline and debug viewer for no reason.
